intro: Heracantha armenia, commonly known as Armenian bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Heracantha armenia is valued for its ornamental beauty and is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
